speaker: Niles
text: Calm down, dear.  No, calm down, listen, take a left, then the second right, then a left again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is Maris lost again?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, she wandered into the kitchen by mistake.  I had to talk her back to the living room.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking round:_] It's kinda busy, any chance of getting a table?

speaker: Niles
text: Not at the moment.  The table by the window received their check five minutes ago but they have been sitting there yammering away every since.  I've been shooting them dirty looks, but they haven't budged.

speaker: Frasier
text: Show me the look.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're there for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: Meantime, shall we go ahead and order?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh why not? [_to waitress:_] What are your coffees today?

speaker: Waitress
text: Zimbabwe and Kenya.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll have a Zimbabwe latte.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll have a Kenyan cappuccino.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, what's new?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Yoshi the gardener finally won the battle of the wills. He got Maris to dig up her camellias so he could put in that precious Zen garden that he's been hocking us about since last fall.

speaker: Frasier
text: How did that turn out?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's beautiful, it's the perfect place for meditation. Yesterday, I found Maris smack-dab in the middle sitting in the lotus position.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well good for her, apparently it's bringing out her spiritual side.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not sure, she reading a Danielle Steel novel, making a nail appointment on her cellular phone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you realize that today marks a year since I moved here from Boston?

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  A year!  It seems like yesterday dad moved in with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't funny how two people can have distinct, opposite impressions of the same event?

speaker: Niles
text: [_moving to the window seat:_] They are both sitting there as if they own that table.  Maybe if we both gave them the look.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's worth a try. [_They both stare at them, and they move._] Niles, I'll never doubt you again! [_they give high fives_] _However, by the time that Niles and Frasier have got their possessions from the counter, a couple have already seated themselves.  Niles and Frasier are angered by this._

speaker: Niles
text: Try the look on this table, I'm going to the men's room. _Niles leaves, whilst Frasier stares at a couple at their usual table.  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Cafe Nervosa However, they haven't budged a few minutes later when Niles come back from the men's room with wet hands._

speaker: Niles
text: Maddening!

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it now?

speaker: Niles
text: They have a new moisturizer dispenser in the men's room, and the cream is entirely too oily, so I had to rewash my hands, and would you know it, that is when the hot-air hand dryer decides to break down!

speaker: Frasier
text: How do you get through the day?

speaker: Waitress
text: [_bringing coffees:_] Here we go, Zimbabwe and Kenyan.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not pleased_] Oh, excuse me, did I say decaf?

speaker: Waitress
text: No, you didn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  If I drink the regular it'll keep me tossing and turning all through my brother's conversation. [_she takes it_] Well Niles, it doesn't look like anybody is leaving, why don't we take a table outside?

speaker: Niles
text: Why not, I'm feeling al fresco.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how does Mrs. Fresco feel about that? _They chuckle away as they go to the outside seats.  They find a table and some chairs exactly in front of the entrance.  Frasier watches Niles wipe down the seat meticulously._

speaker: Frasier
text: It must be a riot on camping trips!

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like a...?

speaker: Niles
text: So, Frasier, now that chapter two of your life is in full swing, do you mind if I ask you something?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, go right ahead.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you happy?

speaker: Niles
text: Did you hear the question?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm thinking.  It's a seemingly complex question.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not.  Either you're happy or you're not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you happy?

speaker: Niles
text: No, but we're not talking about me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let's not just gloss over that.  You, my only brother, has just told me you're not happy and it pains me to hear that, so why?

speaker: Niles
text: I was watching PBS the other night in my study and they were showing this documentary on the Great Depression. Vintage Steinbeck - desperately poor people escaping the Dust Bowl, their meager possessions strapped to rickety old trucks heading to what they thought was their salvation.  Then there was this scene with this scruffy boy being handed a brand-new pair of shoes by the Salvation Army.  Frasier, if you saw the look on that boy's face.  It was a look of pure and utter happiness.  I have never experienced that kind of happiness, not in my whole life.  Not even when I bought these four hundred dollar Bruno Maglies. [_shows shoes off_] Do you like them?

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you like them?

speaker: Niles
text: What about the tassels?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not much of a tassel guy.

speaker: Niles
text: No, neither am I, nevertheless there they are. [_thinks_] Oh, I have no reason to be unhappy.  I have my health, have a wonderful home, a beautiful wife... did your eyebrow just move?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Niles
text: I've got my practice.  Although, lately I've lost track of the ideals that led me to psychiatry in the first place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Look who I'm talking to.  Psychiatry's answer to the drive- through window.  You know, sometimes I wonder if I'm not just in psychiatry for the money.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I wouldn't say that's true.  In a word... forget it.

speaker: Niles
text: What were you going to say?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd rather not.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there's no need, I think I know what you were getting at.  You've been wanting to ask me this for years: did I marry Maris for the money? [_Frasier nods_] I resent that! I did not marry Maris for the money.  It was just a delightful bonus.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you really do love her?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course I love her.  But it's a different kind of love.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean it's not human?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I mean it doesn't burn with the passion and intensity of a Tristan and Isolde.  It's more comfortable, more familiar.  Maris and I are old friends.  We can spend an afternoon together - me at my jigsaw puzzle, she at her auto-harp - not a word spoken between us and be perfectly content.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm told it was a lot like that near the end in the Hitler household.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh fine, let's shift this subject back to where it belongs. This whole thing started with me asking whether you were happy.  And don't think about it this time, just answer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Aw, well...

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming over:_] Hey, guys!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.  What are you doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I always wanted to learn to fly a jet and today they're offering a special on jet flying lessons, so I thought I'd come by and take advantage of it. [_Niles doesn't understand._] I came to get coffee!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thanks for stopping by, I'd have been mad if you didn't.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm also meeting someone here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let me guess, a man?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_imitating:_] Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: The new guy from the news department, Andy Winslow. He's really cute.  He caught me checking him out when he was bending over the water fountain.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Love at first sight!

speaker: Roz
text: Anyway, he said why don't we get some coffee and get to know each other? [_adding makeup:_] I don't know Frasier, I've got a strange feeling that this guy might be the one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, honey, you say that about every guy you meet. Let's just see if this one calls back.

speaker: Roz
text: [_takes Niles's serviette and uses it to wipe her lipstick._] Yeah.  I guess, you know, I don't think he's here yet.  I'll just go and snag a table.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Luck!

speaker: Niles
text: Bye, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah. [_leaves_]

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think she likes me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it isn't a question of liking or not liking. She despises you!

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  Why should I warrant such strong emotions?  I barely acknowledge her existence.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think you may be onto something there, Sherlock!

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks into the caf e_] She is comely, in a back-alley sort of way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, yes she's very attractive.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you ever think about you two, you know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz and me? [_laughs_] No!

speaker: Niles
text: You've never fantasized about stealing away to a cheap little motel with her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, I'm a normal man with normal urges.  She does have a silk blouse that falls open a bit when she leans over the cart rack.  But mixing work with romance, I don't know, is it ever worth it?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, you tell me.  You're the one who looked down her blouse!

speaker: Waitress
text: Decaf Zimbabwe Latte.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that non-fat milk?

speaker: Waitress
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I hate to be a bother, it's just that I'm watching my fat intake. [_she takes it away, then it begins to rain_]

speaker: Niles
text: What is that?  Rain?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastically:_] No, God is crying!

speaker: Niles
text: I asked a simple question.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you ask any other kind? _Niles and Frasier walk in and see Roz, who has managed to get their usual front row table.  They see a group moving near the bookcase, so they head over there, but a couple get to it first.  The people on the window seat move so they dash over there.  A man is just about to get there, but Niles blocks him out of his way.  They finally sit down._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good work there, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: I think I just wanted it a little more than he did. [_looking out of the window:_] Boy, it's really coming down. [_Frasier looks out and begins laughing._] What?  What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just something that happened the other morning.  I asked dad to pass me a bran muffin.  You know what he said to me? He said, "What's the magic word?"

speaker: Niles
text: You're kidding.

speaker: Frasier
text: He didn't think it was very amusing when I said "rest home!" [_they both laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_sees Roz with a man_] Oh look, look, that must be Roz's coffee companion.  Wow!  He's really handsome, isn't he?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Wow!"  Did you say "Wow?"

speaker: Niles
text: Good lord, I did.  I've never said "Wow" when describing another man before.  I wonder if that means something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, absolutely. [_sarcastic:_] It means you're a gay man. Your life with Maris was a charade and you should have come out of the closet years ago.  Are you going to tell dad or shall I? [_laughs_] _Meanwhile, a rather wet Daphne and Martin enter with Eddie by their side._

speaker: Martin
text: This was stupid, this whole thing was stupid, admit it.

speaker: Daphne
text: It was not stupid!  You needed your exercise.  What was stupid was you came out without your bumbershoot!

speaker: Martin
text: It's called an umbrella!  Speak English, can't you?

speaker: Waitress
text: [_coming over:_] I'm sorry, sir, no dogs allowed.

speaker: Martin
text: [_acts like a blind man:_] What?

speaker: Waitress
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: It's okay, okay.

speaker: Martin
text: [_feels Niles's face:_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, dad, what are you two doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I thought we needed some exercise, and I had to come down here to pick up some beans anyway, so we walked.  Well, two of us walked.  One of us had to be dragged by his collar.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I told you I didn't want to come here in the first place.  Look at me, I'm going to die of pneumonia.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you'll outlive us all.  The cranky ones always do. [_Niles goes to the counter with her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, let's get you something hot to drink. [_Frasier summons the waitress_] Em, cappuccino, latte?

speaker: Waitress
text: [_to Martin:_] Can I help you?

speaker: Martin
text: Coffee, black, and don't put anything fancy in it.

speaker: Waitress
text: We have two special coffees. [_Martin stares, bored_] I'll surprise you. [_leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Eddie sits next to him_] Oh, joy.  There's nothing like the smell of a wet dog to work up the appetite for supper!

speaker: Martin
text: Look at us, we're soaked to the skin!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're in a fine mood today!

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, and by the way you left a mess in the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: I had a piece of toast!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and you didn't use a plate like I asked you too, and you put it in under the counter. [_Niles sits down with his briefcase_] And all because you left a bunch a crumbs and toast sweat there!

speaker: Niles
text: Toast sweat?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, it's when you put a piece of hot toast on any surface, and it leaves droplets of dew behind.  Haven't you heard dad's lecture on the evils of toast sweat?  It's the scourge of our times.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_with coffees:_] One coffee, black. _Martin, still pretending to be blind, reaches for the coffee.  The Waitress guides his hand to it._

speaker: Waitress
text: And a decaf, non-fat, Zimbabwee Latte.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, is that cinnamon on that foam?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Martin:_] Well you know, as long as we're picking at each other's scabs here, I found another one of Eddie's chew toys in my sweater cubby the other day, hairs all over my favorite pullover.  I know he sleeps in there when I'm not home!

speaker: Martin
text: It serves you right for keeping your sweaters in a place called "the cubby."

speaker: Frasier
text: That's it, my bedroom is off limits to this fleabag.

speaker: Martin
text: He's not a flea bag.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey dad, how about those Mariners?

speaker: Martin
text: Shut up, Niles.  Look, who's kidding here?  If my hip's good enough to get me down here, then maybe it's about time I found a place of my own.

speaker: Niles
text: Where will you go?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry about me, I'll find a place.  I've got a little money saved up.  I never wanted to move in with you in the first place, and the last thing I want to do is...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with him_] ..."to be a burden to anybody."

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Niles:_] That's your brother's smart-ass way of telling me he's heard this before.  Well, you won't have to hear it again, come on Eddie.  Tell Daphne to catch up with us, will you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, we go through this little melodrama at least once a week.  Will you just sit down, it's raining outside.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  I'll pay for coffee too, how much is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: A dollar-fifty.

speaker: Martin
text: For coffee?  What kind of world are we living in?  _Martin exits into the rain, whilst Frasier decides to take a visit to the toilet._   _Act Two.  Later, Niles is at the counter where Daphne has just got her beans. Frasier comes back, also with wet hands._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, are you alright?  You've been in there forever.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I tried that damn hand cream, [_wipes his hand on serviette_] I was so oily I couldn't get a grip on the doorknob.  I awaited to be rescued, finally when some guy came in I said, "Oh God, am I glad to see you."  I can't even begin to describe the look he gave me.

speaker: Frasier
text: There it is!

speaker: Daphne
text: So, your brother tells me you and your father are at it again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yeah, what's new?

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know what's wrong with him.  Lately, he's had a face as long as a wet weekend.  Yesterday, when I insisted he do his exercises, he told me to put my feet behind my head and spin like a top. [_Niles begins to fantasize about this_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, best thing to do, just ignore him when he gets sarcastic.  Isn't that right, Niles?  Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_after coming out of the daydream_] I'm sorry, Frasier.  For some reason I feel a little dizzy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I guess I better go after him.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, here. [_hands her his umbrella_] Take my bumbershoot.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, isn't that nice.  Well, at least someone appreciates my mother tongue. [_leaves_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I've always had an ear for your tongue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: What did I say?  Want another coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not until I've had my first one, thanks! [_Niles signals for another coffee_] Why is it always so difficult between me and dad?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, you might try looking at it from dad's point of view.  As a policeman in a position of authority and that's been taken away from him.  Wailing against the world is his way of controlling his ever-shrinking sphere of influence.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I do empathize with him.  I just can't help wishing I could just kick that cane out from under him once in a while and that he would land on Eddie!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the simple truth is, it's hard.  I know you're trying!

speaker: Frasier
text: I am!  And you know, sometimes I do see the fruits of my labor.  You know, just the other night dad was watching TV and I had fallen asleep on the couch and suddenly I stirred, I felt something on my head, and dad was standing above me stroking my hair.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?!  Did he say anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he said, "don't think it's time you got a hair cut, you're starting to look like bozo!"  I know he was only covering though.  But what do you think?

speaker: Niles
text: Probably wouldn't hurt to get a trim!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Do you think he was covering?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course he was covering, you know dad!  Tough as nails on the outside, but on the inside one giant... spike.

speaker: Niles
text: _Grazie._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, but what about mine?

speaker: Waitress
text: We've got a team of specialists working on it. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, why don't we just change the subject from dad, and talk about something else.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely, pick a new topic.  Something light and frothy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I agree.  Are you in love with Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a little frothier than I had in mind!

speaker: Niles
text: That preposterous!  I refuse to dignify that question with an answer.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know!  There, I said it.  There, are you happy? Oh, why did you have to hire Venus herself?  Couldn't you have found some beefy, East-European scrub woman who reeked of ammonia?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I asked, but it was an Olympic year.  The agency was fresh out.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I can't get her out of my mind.  When I look at Daphne she stirs a passion in me I've never known before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're not considering leaving Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Certainly not!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose the situation you're in is that you'd like to stay with Maris but you'd like an affair with Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Can I do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you can't!

speaker: Niles
text: I thought that I couldn't but you got my hopes up there for a minute.  Oh, it's easy for you.  You're free, you're happy - although perhaps I'm getting ahead of myself there, you haven't answered that question yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I haven't answered it, have I?

speaker: Niles
text: You haven't and I'm getting curious.  Are you happy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess the best way I can think of saying it is...

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming over:_] This sucks!

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Roz
text: You sit down with someone and have a cup of coffee and think that they might just might lead you to something, like a life!  Suddenly the trap door opens and you're right back in Roz's world!

speaker: Niles
text: How did it go wrong so quickly?

speaker: Roz
text: Hmm, simple.  He didn't want to date me.  He wanted to convert me!  I don't have anything against religious people. I don't care if they're Jewish, or Jehovah Witness or Buddhist.  I am ecumenical, I embrace men of all faiths!

speaker: Frasier
text: If only it stopped there!

speaker: Roz
text: But he pretended he was going to ask me out, isn't there a Commandment against that?

speaker: Niles
text: No, they didn't get into dating until the New Testament.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry Roz, why don't you join us?

speaker: Roz
text: No, no thank you.  There's a cute new handyman in my building. I thought I'd just go home, slip into a negligee and rip out my faucet. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You think she's kidding, don't you?  You know, I think about Roz's life and it makes me wonder about my own.  I haven't been exactly burning up the social scene lately.

speaker: Niles
text: You'll find somebody.

speaker: Frasier
text: But what if I don't?  What if I end up old and alone? I just might have to buy a funny little dog and move in With Frederick.  I guess I don't need to worry about that for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: No, Frederick should start worrying about it.  In the meantime, you might want to answer my ever-more-tedious original question.  Are you happy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess I'd have to say...

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering with Eddie:_] Hello, boys.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, for Pete's sake!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello dad, what are you doing back here?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  I've been acting like a jerk these past couple of days, and I've been taking it out on you and Daphne.  You know all that stuff I said earlier?  Just forget about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I already have.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, dad, listen.  Has something been bothering you these past few days?

speaker: Martin
text: No, not really, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, say it.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  Last Sunday was my birthday.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course it was!  Frasier and I were planning a big surprise party.  But, if we threw it on your birthday it wouldn't have been a surprise, thus we waited a week.  So, surprise!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, if you could just see the look on your face...

speaker: Frasier
text: Just give it up, Niles!  Dad, I'm sorry.  Listen, come and have a seat.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I don't know why I let it bother me.  All those years on the force, I missed enough of you boys' birthdays. You're entitled to miss one of mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, there's no reason to stop us celebrating anyway.  Tonight, we'll take you out for dinner.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't need to do that!

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely, absolutely, you name the place.

speaker: Martin
text: OK, how about Hoppy's Old Heidleberg?

speaker: Martin
text: They were voted best bratwurst of all time for three years in a row.

speaker: Frasier
text: _Ach du lieber!_ [_they laugh_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_walking in:_] There you are.  I've been up and down Third Street looking for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I was on Fourth Street, Eddie had already smelled everything on Third.  How did you know I was coming back here anyway?

speaker: Daphne
text: I had one of my psychic flashes.  Bang! - there you were, walking through the door of Cafe Nervosa.  And there you were, apologizing for the way you've treated me this past week.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm sorry about that, Daphne.  Just forget about it, alright?

speaker: Daphne
text: And something about a raise. [_looks to Frasier_]

speaker: Martin
text: You're winging it now, aren't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Am I that transparent?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm psychic.  Come on, we've gotta hurry up because the boys are taking us to Hoppy's Old Heidleberg tonight for dinner!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh great, German food.  We whipped the Jerries twice this century and they still have the last laugh. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, dad I'd give you a ride, but I've got to stop by the station first.

speaker: Martin
text: Nah.

speaker: Niles
text: No, that's okay, I'll give him a lift.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, as always I've enjoyed getting together with you for coffee.

speaker: Martin
text: What do you guys talk about all the time?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know - sports, chicks, monster truck rallies...

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, don't tell me.  _Niles and Martin leave, Frasier awaits his decaf, non-fat milk, non-cinammon foam Zimbabwe Latte alone.  The waitress arrives, with yet another cup of coffee._

speaker: Waitress
text: Zimbabwe, decaf, non-fat milk, no cinnamon in sight. Now - ARE YOU HAPPY?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_answering Niles's question:_] You know, in the greater scheme... yes, I'd say I am.
